title: Wow Zac changes are even worse than I thought they would be
body:
Yesterday I made a post about how I thought the changes to zac ult made him completely vulnerable and disrupted his in-fight play style. I was right on all points with one marked exception:
- they halved the knockup duration on his e so now he is utterly dependent on his ult to disrupt teamfights. Funny, because I don't want to ult even when its up.

But this post isn't about that. This post is about the beautiful brain child changes to his q:
Previously his q was a basic short range poke with some slow. It was fine, it was reliable. You shoot it and move on with your life. It was the ability you levelled last for some added value.
Now, his q is single target, it casts slower, and to get your fancy little "boop" (which barely even matches the aoe dmg of the original) you not only have to get into range to auto a second person (fyi there MUST be a second target) you have to sit there and watch the quarter second cast animation. And, worst of all you have to AUTO. because zac is known for autoing.

I'll give you a hint, previously I didn't even auto post 6 on zac because the opportunity cost was too high. The champions FUNDAMENTAL mechanic is to kite and farm his blobs. His blobs represent both sustain AND damage. But I'm being hard on Riot. His q now gives him the ability to slightly displace enemies.

I will never play the champion again, nor will anybody else, because they've completely broken the champions core mechanic.

replies.body:
I'm sure you're just over reac- 
[OH MY GOD](http://lolalytics.com/champion/Zac/)
I am a senile idiot, so please explain if we're looking at win rate or pick rate here.

Pick rate spiked and win rate plummeted. Pick rate dropped and win rate continued dropping.

It isn't a good look in both cases.
Shows up as a 48-49% win rate for me. Maybe because I'm on mobile.
Spoiler alert, win rate is 38.5%.

To be fair I'm sure everyone is banning him so the sample size is skewed and the data is unreliable. Also, people are trying him out and he's new so there's a bit of a learning curve. But...

38%....? 

Even then... that's pretty damn low. I'd give it a week or two to see how much it increases before buffing him, cuz then we have Ivern, but hot damn.

Ban rate spiked minority with pick rate, before both dropped. *Normally* that is when his win rate would start to climb back to a normal level, but it's actually getting *worse*, because they added *so* much counterplay to his kit that the more experience everyone gets with the new kit, the *weaker* it gets due to enemy players knowing how to avoid everything, rather than becoming stronger because of players mastering his new abilities.

Well, yeah. They *literally* deleted his ult, and nerfed his E and Q. Excising half a champion's kit *tends* to gut them.

The worst part is that even if he's buffed, he has the Shen problem now, cause Bronze levels will let him R you, meaning any numbers that are viable in Plat+ make him super stompy in Bronze-Silver.
Ouch.

Actually the pick rate and the ban rate spiked extremely hard for one day, then fell the day after.

To be fair, Riot always messes up the balance on at least one champion on the higher end and at least one champion on the lower end, and that's just how game balance works for any competitive game.
Is that a 38% win rate? O_O

To be fair, that's not a great metric to use because the pick rate spiked as well. (From 6% to 10%. That's a pretty big leap) There's also the changes which mean Zac doesn't play the same as he used to.

Sure, I'll explain:

I think the overall direction of the game is better than it was/is going. I'm not paid by them, nor am I any sort of fanboy.  If anything, I think they should have adopted this direction earlier. I'm also making a point to make note of flaws. Sure, you can argue a rework is bad/worse/etc. but have good metrics to do it. Day one win-rates on a champion who was fairly easy (I speak as someone with a mastery six Zac and tons of games on him) to something that is WAY harder to play and also far more specific.

More importantly, you can still like the overall direction (More specialized characters) but dislike the changes made overall (Malzahar). Zac I feel is in a position where the IDEAS are good but the implementation might be lacking. Then again, this isn't new for Riot: They grossly overestimate the power on some things and nerf the shit out of it to compensate. 

Besides, I prefer taking the opposite stance. Even if it's not popular to take it. What's gained when the overall discussion amounts to "I HATE THIS" "I HATE IT TOO" "YEAH FUCK IT LET'S MOVE ON". I'm also the person who has criticized them on things that the community agreed upon (Like nerfing Vi, fuck that bullshit) but you probably missed that because most of my posts are from the recent tank update.

Playing the devil's advocate because someone has to for a discussion to have merit and long-term value. 

I can respect that.

Although I'm also hurting for money rn.

If Riot gave me a $50 and punched a baby I'd say the baby had it coming tbh.

True, but none of them are as hard as Zac. Sejuani and Maokai play relatively the same. Zac's skills (Most notably his ult) have changed from something you always use whenever you're in a team fight to something you use specifically when the situation demands it. Most of my teamfighting was "It's ult up? Use that shit". Now I have to plan way ahead.

Zac's whole kit was reliant on his E landing. Now they made him even more unreliable with his unusable ult, and his awkward Q. His ult doesn't even feel rewarding even when you land it properly and grab a few enemies, which might happen once or twice a game.

As you said he already has to manage his blobs, now with his Q it's a nightmare. The little boop is worse than the old and reliable slow. Damage-wise i can't even 1v1 an adc anymore. I just dive in and mmmaaaaaaaaaayyybbbeeeeee land a CC.

Straight up nerf to his kit, gameplay and fun-factor.

New ZAC is terrible. From every point of view. 

Riot tried to make it more fun,  maybe he is, perhaps vs AL or dummies. He is not competitive at all in any way. 

They completely destroyed a champion that was perfect and fun. Nerfed to the ground. 


Q- weaker. No longer AoE slow. Hurts clear. Useless in team fights. 

W- Same thing as always.

E- They even decided to nerf the knock up. Dumb. 

R- Ok, so they removed the duration of the knock up in E, and they totally remove the Ultimate multiple knock ups. They just made an utter garbage Ultimate with no point whatsoever. Its impossible to land at least to the point of re position. So is just an insta knock up with no way out. So you need E, do R, and die. 

Personally I wish I could get a refund for every Zac skin I bought. You destroyed a perfectly balanced and decent champ for nothing.

you can't q someone behind minions or use it for waveclear

they should change this interaction

I always hated zac, with how tanky he was, his ridiculous initiation range, and his decent damage for a tank. 

But this really is not fair. I know they said they wanted tanks to do more, but make them a bit less reliable, but this level of that is stupid
This bites to hear since Zac was my main man in the jungle. Oh well, guess I'mma have to branch out a little (assuming i ever get around to playing again)
Ivern is all about branching out in the jungle

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 

(As a side note, Riot, can we get some more stickers? Fun as these are, it'd be nice to see more)
You should try him first.

While numerically his kit sucks, it's actually really funy smacking a guy with another guy, and the Q is fun(although really clunky) to use. If he gets some QOL on his Q(faster animation, better signaling for how long your aa range is after Q) AND numbers reevaluation(Seriously, his most damaging skill is now his W which is the most boring skill in his kit, numbers on his Q are fucking garbage) then I can see him being very fun to use.

His ult however... Not only are you still getting wailed on while loading R(and he didn't get any buffs to his resilience, on the other hand his E cc went DOWN) it's pretty much impossible to use efficiently without someone ccing them beforehand, and then you have to bring them somewhere useful(like YET ANOTHER teammate who can efficiently AOE, like wukong or nunu). Seems like a lot of trouble to set up something, where you could just have the guy who helps you set up the R, just set up something simpler.

Don't get me wrong, the playstyle is fun, scooping people is flavorful, but his damage on q and R is now garbage and E is straight up worse, he might not need kit changed but number buffs are in order.
Speak for yourself. I've heard people say they love new Zac.

They're the minority.

Mastery 6 Zac. Close to 200 games on him over the last two years. His new kit feels clunky and unfriendly to use. 

The E cooldown is longer, the knockup is weaker, ulti doesn't have anywhere near the same usefulness as it used to, and worst of all, his Q is useless outside of very specific circumstances. 

I get the distinct feeling Zac is going to be the least played rework of the bunch, and he'll probably drop below old Galio in terms of play rate overall. I know I won't be playing him again until this "rework" gets reverted.

> They're the minority.

Show me your factual evidence. You did not survey anyone. You're only looking at the boards.
https://www.reddit.com/r/thesecretweapon/comments/695nb5/to_riot_shrieve_our_overall_opinion_on_the_zac/
Again. The boards and Reddit's Zac mains do not represent the entire zac player community accurately. It only gives you an idea.

If the engaged community of Zac mains spanning pretty much every ELO does not like the changes, it's a fair bet that the other zac mains out there are also disappointed.

I wouldn't go survey uninformed Europeans on the subject of American elections. I would go to Americans who are engaged in campaigning for or against candidates and ask their opinions because they have background and stake.

Instead of asking random zac mains who are too apathetic to speak up in support or opposition to the rework, I'd rather look at what exists in public discussion with Riot and go from there.
i don't like the rework... his q looks stupid with the fucking goo sticking out of him and his ult isn't the same incredible ability that made him so fun to play
I get the feeling that this rework is more divisive which probably means it's bad.

I feel like Riot really messed up. His E is now weaker. Ulti is not NA Solo Q friendly, maybe only in Korea and China will it be viable (KR for being strategic and meticulous, CN because of the teamfight chaos specialist). But in NA... for better or for worse, mostly worse, it will be awful.

I miss the old Sejuani, at least there was counter play when her ult was down... that is until she is nerfed. Can't wait for it.

Back to Zac, his Q is quite cool, but it is not reliable. And with the new changes to Hp or tank items, Zac feels for the most part useless as you are not able to survive aas long. While Sejuani seems to have received more beneficial huge changes that are OP buffs, while Zac seems to have mostly been nerfed, while giving him some interesting fantasy that thus far is just that, a fantasy (and will take a few patches to get him right). 

I don't feel it is a God Awful rework. But it is starting off bad.
New Zac is dope as hell.  The new Q is crazy OP if you are in the thick of the fight and his new ult has very interesting dynamics too it.
i was watching some high elo streams that featured some fantastic zac gameplay. He looks so much more interesting now, and the plays he can make with his new Q is actually really cool imo...

His Q interaction is really, REALLY wonky. They need to clean up the animation and cast time on the Q+auto because my champion ends up flailing around trying to find the right auto...at least make it reset the auto attack.

EDIT: And guys, stop freaking out. Based on what I saw, Zac will most definitely get buffs or fixes in the next couple of patches. He is not in a good spot right now.
{{champion:57}} is the only decent rework of the update. {{champion:113}} kit is SO insanely unbalanced. She is either complete trash or she is a god.

New Zac needs to be made more interesting. My suggestions:

**Passive**
Health Healing: 4% at all levels -> 4/5/6% (at levels 1/6/18)

**Q**
- Now increases basic attack range to 450 (or so) and increases the AA animation speed by 75% (or so)

**E**
- Knock-Up Duration increased to 0.75 seconds from 0.5 seconds

I think that would remove some clunkiness and make him better overall.

I personally really like Zac's new Q. It actually gives him an extra form of hard cc during a gank. Yesterday I e'd into a lane but failed to connect with the slingshot. I q'd the enemy orianna and auto attacked a minion to cc her long enough for my laner to kill her. With the old Q the slow would have allowed her to escape. The new Q is especially good in team fights as it disrupts enemy positioning. It does feel clunkier to cast than the old Q, but I think it's a massive improvement. 

The new ult is difficult to use with the halved knock up on the slingshot. However, when you do pull an enemy adc back into your team with it and you win the game off of it then it feels extremely satisfying. It's definitely more difficult to use than the previous ult, but it makes for some really cool moments.
